title: Girl Scouts Lose Trademark Lawsuit Over Boy Scouts Marketing
sub_head: A federal judge says the Girl Scouts feared for its ‘competitive position’ after Boy Scouts welcomed girls into core youth programs
body:
A federal judge on Thursday ruled that the Boy Scouts of America didn’t infringe on the Girl Scouts of the USA’s trademarks, saying the girls-only group failed to show any confusion from the Boy Scouts’ efforts to recruit girls into coed programming.
Judge Alvin Hellerstein with the U.S. District Court of New York dismissed the Girl Scouts’ lawsuit alleging the Boy Scouts had damaged the Girl Scouts trademark rights and confused the public by using gender-neutral phrases like “Scout Me In.”
